contents: Autism spectrum disorder (ASD) is a range of complex disorders with symptoms that (6) <u>varies</u> significantly from individual to individual. ASD manifests in social impairments, communication difficulties, and restricted, repetitive behavior patterns.  The most severe form of ASD is known as autistic disorder, (7) <u>who</u> is sometimes simply referred to as “autism.” Asperger syndrome is a milder form of ASD. Other disorders vary in severity and symptoms. ASD occurs in all ethnic, socioeconomic, and (8) <u>age groups; accordingly,</u> males are four times more likely to have ASD than females.
